ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of Russian from scratch. I learned a new alphabet, grammar, vocabulary and oral expressions.
I learned how to read, write, and speak basic Russian. I was also exposed to Russian art and literature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: very efficient in giving everything needed to have a basic conversation in Russian. 
Weaknesses: n/a

This course was amazing. Strengths are that I received personal attention throughout and really felt like my Russian improved a lot. Weaknesses is maybe we shouldnt have at first learned cursive Cyrillic. Sometimes the class went over time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn a slavic language and Russian in particular, go for it, it's perfect. If you work seriously, you will improve very fast and gain a lot of abilities.
Definitely recommend. You will receive great feedback and really see your improvement.
